div.p: Whenever you read some text relating to computers and the WWWWorld Wide Web, you find a lot of lingoa characteristic language of a particular group. Some examples are WYSIWYGwhat you see is what you get, AJAXAsynchronous JavaScript And XML and CAPTCHACompletely Automated Turing Test To Tell Computers and Humans Apart. More on Turing tests at The Alan Turing Home Page or at Wikipedia, inspired from the works of Alan Turing.

Of course this lingo is usefull for precision and ease of discussion. We need some precision to discuss the differences and similarities between for instance MVCModel View Controller as introduced by Trygve Reenskaug and the more recently coined principle of SoCSeparation of Concerns, Wikipedia has an introduction.
On the other hand you sometimes get the feeling that the lingo serves the same purpose as one can suspect that did in medieval services; To mystify more than to clearify.
Personally I think we should try to apply the KISSKeep It Simple Stupid-principle, in most situations of life.
